element.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important
element.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Business and management elements are built into the course.
Besides ability, the other essential element in political success is luck.
Honesty is a vital element of her success.
the primary element in the country’s economy
element.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a simple chemical substance such as carbon or oxygen that consists of atoms of only one kind
element.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a group of people who form part of a larger group, especially when the rest of the group does not approve of them
element.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: the hard-line communist elements in the party
element.translation[0].definitions[3].de: the part of a piece of electrical equipment that produces heat
element.translation[0].definitions[4].de: one of the four substances (earth, air, fire, and water) from which people used to believe that everything was made
element.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: This one fact is the most important element of the theory.
Private study is a major element of the students’ timetable.
Trust is a key element in any relationship.
The most crucial element of our economic system is the law of supply and demand.
Her determination is a vital element of her success.
The reform programme has three main elements.
